text:
Jesús Vaquero Crespo (1950 – 17 April 2020) was a Spanish neurosurgeon. He was a known person on the treatment of medullary injuries. He was born in Madrid. He became chief of Neurosurgery of the Hospital Puerta de Hierro in 1992. He was a professor of the Autonomous University of Madrid (UAM).
Vaquero died on 17 April 2020 due to COVID-19 in Madrid, aged 70.
